first_reasoning: We should allocate the full $10 million to the Industrial Products Division because its sales have grown every year and it sits on proprietary process‐control and sensor IP that can be rapidly turned into modular add-ons. Carving out $2 million for quick-win prototypes and embedding stage-gate reviews ensures we capture margin uplifts in real time and protect new inventions, while our field service teams will translate those gains directly into customer value and billable hours. This phased approach maximizes speed to market, shields us from competitor catch-up, and drives us back into profitability most efficiently.
second_reasoning: We allocate the entire $20 million to the Industrial Products Division because its revenue has grown steadily and it holds proprietary process-control and sensor IP that can be rapidly developed into modular add-ons. This approach maximizes our speed to profitability and shields us from competitor catch-up more effectively than splitting funds with Consumer Products.
